original: 'dir ni mchod pa rnam pa lnga'i kha bskang ba'i don du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni mchod pa rnam pa lnga'i kha bskang ba'i don du gsungs pa'o //
translated: Here, it is stated for the purpose of supplementing the five types of worship.

original: mchod bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don ji lta ba nyid kyi phyir ma bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mchod bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don ji lta ba nyid kyi phyir ma bshad pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of what is to be worshipped and so forth is self-evident.

original: rab mnyam gzhag ces pa ni thams cad du mchod pa'i cho ga rnam par dag pa rdo rje yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rab mnyam gzhag ces pa ni thams cad du mchod pa'i cho ga rnam par dag pa rdo rje yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase well-equipoised means that the entire ritual of worship is pure, and that it is the vajra.

analyzed: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i 'khor lo mchod pa'i cho ga'i le'u gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /

analyzed: dang por slob dpon zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rigs gcig tu bstan pas dkyil 'khor dang nye ba'i slob dpon rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

analyzed: ci nus pas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bla ma'i mchod pa ston pa'o //

analyzed: dril dbyangs zhes bya bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gtso bo'i bya ba brjod pa'o //

analyzed: go cha chen po la sogs pas go bgos la slob ma rnams kyang de bzhin du bya'o //üîΩmnyam par gzhag ste phyag rgya mchod //

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas ni dbang bskur ba ston to /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas ni dbang bskur ba ston to /
translated: Thus, and so forth, indicates the empowerment conferral.

original: phyag rgya ni phyi rol gyi yan lag can te sngags dang phyag rgya legs par bslabs shing /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni phyi rol gyi yan lag can te sngags dang phyag rgya legs par bslabs shing /

analyzed: bsrung bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba'i dam tshig gis dam tshig dang ldan pa zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: de nas nyi ma gnyis pa la yang dkyil 'khor mchod cing byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa byas la dkyil 'khor dang nye ba'am //
translated: Then, on the second day, having worshipped the ma·πá·∏çala, blessed, and so on, having placed the disciple near the ma·πá·∏çala,

analyzed: yol bas bar bcad par shing khri la sogs pa legs pa'i stan la rab tu bzhag ste /

original: gsang ba'i dbang brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang brtsam par bya'o //

analyzed: mtshal chen lan gsum bzlas pa yis // de la thig le bya ba yin //

original: zhes pa ni gang gi tshe sngon du bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyi rol gyi yan lag me tog dang ldan par gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gang gi tshe sngon du bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyi rol gyi yan lag me tog dang ldan par gyur pa yin na /

original: de'i tshe de dang lhan cig tu rjes su chags pa'i rim pas ji ltar dga' bar 'gyur ba de ltar rdo rje dang padma bskyod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba sbyor thabs kyi gnas skabs su slob ma'i gdong bcings la snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dang
analyzed: de'i tshe de dang lhan cig tu rjes su chags pa'i rim pas ji ltar dga' bar 'gyur ba de ltar rdo rje dang padma bskyod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba sbyor thabs kyi gnas skabs su slob ma'i gdong bcings la snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dang
translated: At that time, in whatever way one delights in the process of passion with that mudra, one should engage in the activities of shaking the vajra and lotus and so on.üîΩ

original: phreng ba'i sngags brjod cing //
analyzed: phreng ba'i sngags brjod cing //
translated: At that time, in the same way that one becomes delighted by the process of passion, one should engage in the activities of shaking the vajra and lotus, and so forth, in the context of the method of union.

original: mgo bo dang dpral ba dang / mig gnyis dang / kha dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga ste @174a * //
analyzed: mgo bo dang dpral ba dang / mig gnyis dang / kha dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga ste @174a * //
translated: One should recite the essence mantra, the quintessence mantra, and the garland mantra.

original: gnas bdun du rdo rje dang padma las byung ba'i dbang bskur ba sbyin no //
analyzed: gnas bdun du rdo rje dang padma las byung ba'i dbang bskur ba sbyin no //
translated: One should give the empowerment that arises from the vajra and lotus in the seven places:üîΩthe head, the forehead, the two eyes, the mouth, the throat, and the heart.

original: slob mas kyang kha ru byin pa de bdud rtsi bzhin du myang bar bya'o //
analyzed: slob mas kyang kha ru byin pa de bdud rtsi bzhin du myang bar bya'o //

original: de nas gdong phye dkyil 'khor bstan //
analyzed: de nas gdong phye dkyil 'khor bstan //
translated: Then, the face is uncovered and the ma·πá·∏çala is shown.

original: gang gi lha yi gnas gang yin /
analyzed: gang gi lha yi gnas gang yin /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever deity‚Äôs place it is,‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni gsang ba'i dbang gi gnas de dang de bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gsang ba'i dbang gi gnas de dang de bstan par bya'o //

analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i dus su phyi rol gyi yan lag can bstan par bya ba ni don dam pa'i don to //
translated: The external member to be taught at the time of initiation is the ultimate meaning.

original: yang dag ces pa ni rtog pa med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: yang dag ces pa ni rtog pa med pa'i sems so //
translated: The word right is the mind free from conceptualization.

original: de nas slob mas kyang yang de bzhin du brtsam par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas slob mas kyang yang de bzhin du brtsam par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Then, the disciple also should commence in the same way.

original: de nas slob dpon mnyam gzhag la //
analyzed: de nas slob dpon mnyam gzhag la //
translated: Then, the master, in equipoise,

original: rab tu gdung pa byas nas ni //
analyzed: rab tu gdung pa byas nas ni //
translated: having generated intense passion,

original: g-yon nas brtsams pa'i rim pa yis //
analyzed: g-yon nas brtsams pa'i rim pa yis //

original: de la bskor ba rab tu bya //
analyzed: de la bskor ba rab tu bya //
translated: he should circumambulate her.

original: dkyil 'khor dang ni bla ma la //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang ni bla ma la //
translated: To the ma·πá·∏çala and the guru,

original: ci bzhin cho gas phyag bya'o //
analyzed: ci bzhin cho gas phyag bya'o //
translated: one should pay homage with the proper ritual.

original: zhes pa ni ji ltar bla mas slob ma la gsang ba'i dbang byin pa de lta bu'i cho gas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni ji ltar bla mas slob ma la gsang ba'i dbang byin pa de lta bu'i cho gas brtsams te /
translated: This means that one should commence in the same way that the guru bestows the secret empowerment on the disciple.

original: slob mas bla ma la phyag byas nas de nyid dang lhan cig tu zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: slob mas bla ma la phyag byas nas de nyid dang lhan cig tu zhes dgongs so //
translated: The disciple should pay homage to the guru and then, together with him,

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: the rest is easy to understand.

original: rtses dang blta ba zhes bya bas ni gsang ba'i dbang bstan to //
analyzed: rtses dang blta ba zhes bya bas ni gsang ba'i dbang bstan to //
translated: The words play and gaze indicate the secret empowerment.

original: lag bcangs 'khyud dang zhes pas ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bstan to //
analyzed: lag bcangs 'khyud dang zhes pas ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bstan to //
translated: The phrase embracing with the hands indicates the wisdom-knowledge initiation.

original: gnyis gnyis sprod ces bya bas ni dbang bzhi pa la gsal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis sprod ces bya bas ni dbang bzhi pa la gsal bar byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase the two pairs clarifies the fourth initiation.

original: slob dpon gyi dbang ngam /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dbang ngam /
translated: The phrase the master initiation

original: yang na ni bum pa'i dbang dang / dbang gzhan gyi khyad par yang bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ni bum pa'i dbang dang / dbang gzhan gyi khyad par yang bstan pa'o //
translated: or the vase initiation indicates the other special initiations.

original: 'di rnams kyi don bdag gis bshad pa ni bla ma'i man ngag dran par bya ba'i don du dbang bskur ba legs par rtogs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don bdag gis bshad pa ni bla ma'i man ngag dran par bya ba'i don du dbang bskur ba legs par rtogs par byas pa'o //
translated: The meaning of these is explained by me for the purpose of recalling the guru's instructions, which are well understood in the bestowal of initiation.

original: bshad dang ma bshad gang ci'ang rung //
analyzed: bshad dang ma bshad gang ci'ang rung //
translated: Whatever is explained or not explained

original: de kun dpal ldan khrag 'thung gnas //
analyzed: de kun dpal ldan khrag 'thung gnas //
translated: all of that is the abode of glorious Heruka.

original: zhes pa ni thabs gzhan gyis ma bshad cing ma bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni thabs gzhan gyis ma bshad cing ma bstan te /
translated: This is not explained or taught by other methods.

original: mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma'i slob ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid la bshad cing bstan pa gang cung zad yin pa de yang thams cad dpal he ru ka lhan cig skyes pa don dam pa'i sa bon gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma'i slob ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid la bshad cing bstan pa gang cung zad yin pa de yang thams cad dpal he ru ka lhan cig skyes pa don dam pa'i sa bon gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Whatever has been explained and taught as the nature of the best, middling, and least disciples, etc., all that is the nature of the seed of the ultimate, the coemergent glorious Heruka.

original: dpal he ru ka la rnam par gnas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka la rnam par gnas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it abides in the glorious Heruka.

original: de ltar yang /üîΩdngos po kun gyi sa bon de //
analyzed: de ltar yang / dngos po kun gyi sa bon de //
translated: Thus it is said:üîΩThat seed of all things

original: dngos grub kun gyi mchog gi don //
analyzed: dngos grub kun gyi mchog gi don //
translated: is the supreme meaning of all powers,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi ched byed gnas //üîΩbde ba can du mngon par brjod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi ched byed gnas // bde ba can du mngon par brjod //
translated: the abode of the performance of the purpose of all buddhas,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: and is called the Land of Bliss.

original: 'dis ni lhan @174b cig skyes pa don dam pa'i sa bon gyi ngo bo nyid mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma'i dngos grub la sogs pa la rol ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lhan @174b cig skyes pa don dam pa'i sa bon gyi ngo bo nyid mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma'i dngos grub la sogs pa la rol ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir gyi don to //
translated: This means that because the nature of the seed of the ultimate, the coemergent, is the nature of the display of the best, middling, and least powers, etc.

original: yang na ni /
analyzed: yang na ni /
translated: Or else,

original: bshad dang ma bshad gang ci'ang rung /
analyzed: bshad dang ma bshad gang ci'ang rung /
translated: whatever has been explained or not explained,

original: dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor gyi phyag rgya 'chang ba ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya rdo rje phag mo ru brjod de /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor gyi phyag rgya 'chang ba ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya rdo rje phag mo ru brjod de /
translated: The one who bears the seal of the yoga of glorious Heruka is said to be the wisdom seal VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´,

original: de'i lhan cig skyes pa don dam pa'i sa bon phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo nyid dpal he ru ka yang rnam par gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i lhan cig skyes pa don dam pa'i sa bon phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo nyid dpal he ru ka yang rnam par gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: yang na lhan cig skyes pa don dam pa'i sa bon phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo nyid dpal he ru ka la yang gnas pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: yang na lhan cig skyes pa don dam pa'i sa bon phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo nyid dpal he ru ka la yang gnas pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Or, because the glorious Heruka, who is the essence of the innate ultimate seed, the great seal, also abides in him,

original: bshad pa dang ma bshad pa gang cung zad de thams cad dpal he ru ka la rnam par gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bshad pa dang ma bshad pa gang cung zad de thams cad dpal he ru ka la rnam par gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that whatever is explained or not explained, all of that abides in the glorious Heruka.

original: de ltar de'i ngo bo nyid 'chang ba'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma blta bar bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar de'i ngo bo nyid 'chang ba'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma blta bar bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that the yoga and yoginƒ´ who bear his essence should be seen.

original: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i phan yon dbang bskur ba'i cho ga'i le'u gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i phan yon dbang bskur ba'i cho ga'i le'u gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the third chapter of the Sri Herukabhidhana, the chapter on the benefits of Sri Heruka and the consecration ritual.

original: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: Then, etc.

original: de nas zhes pa ni de'i phyir te rgyu'i don nam /üîΩrjes thogs te mkha' 'gro ma sa la rnam par rol pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni de'i phyir te rgyu'i don nam / rjes thogs te mkha' 'gro ma sa la rnam par rol pa ste /
translated: Here, then means for that reason, or afterward, or because of that.

original: sa steng dang sa bla dang sa 'og gsum khyab pa ste 'khor lo gsum la gnas pa'i don to //
analyzed: sa steng dang sa bla dang sa 'og gsum khyab pa ste 'khor lo gsum la gnas pa'i don to //
translated: The play of the dakinis on the earth means that they pervade the three worlds, the surface of the earth, the sky, and the underworld, and the meaning is that they abide in the three wheels.

analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa so so'i ming ni brtson chen ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston cing gsal por byed pa'i don to //
translated: The individual names of the dakinis, etc., are indicated by the one called MahƒÅvit and so on, and the meaning is that they are made clear.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir 'di dag sngon nyid nas grub pa'i mkha' 'gro ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi zhes brjod do //üîΩrang ming brjod pa'i sngags la ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir 'di dag sngon nyid nas grub pa'i mkha' 'gro ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi zhes brjod do // rang ming brjod pa'i sngags la ni //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The mantra that expresses their individual names is as follows:üîΩThe mantra that expresses their individual names is as follows:

original: de ltar yang /

analyzed: snying po med ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: @175a * // grub gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig tu nus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mthu ston to //

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi khang par bris pa'i dkyil 'khor mthong nas dbang bskur ba'i cho ga yongs su rdzogs pa tsam gyis ji ltar gsungs pa 'di'i yon tan ni grub pa'i rnal 'byor par 'gyur ro //

original: de shes rtag tu sgom pa ni /
analyzed: de shes rtag tu sgom pa ni /

analyzed: de la che ba'i bdag nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de shes shing rtag tu bsgoms pas dngos grub kyi 'bras bur ston pa ni /

analyzed: dngos grub de bzhin gshegs pa gsungs // zhes pa la //

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir de zhes bya ba la sogs pas aom thams cad gsal bar byed pa 'di sngon nas nges par grub pa ste /

original: sngags dang lha nyid dbyer med pa'i rigs pas mkha' 'gro ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rang gi ming brjod pa'i sngags aom dang po dang h'um dang phat mthar sbyar ba ste sngags drug cu po 'dis 'dod pa thams cad 'grub pas grub gsol 'dod pa thams cad ster

translated: By the reasoning that the deity and the mantra are inseparable, the mantra of the twenty-four dakinis, which is their own names, is joined with Om at the beginning and Hum and Phat at the end. By this sixty-syllable mantra, all wishes are accomplished, so it is called the wish-fulfilling gem, which grants all wishes.

original: ba ste / ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i mchog gang gi phyir ster ba nyid kyis rnal 'byor mchog tu shes par byas la 'di nyid du blta ba'o //

original: de'i phyir gzhan snying po med pa'i rtsva dang mtshungs te gzhan du na rtsva dang mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan snying po med pa'i rtsva dang mtshungs te gzhan du na rtsva dang mtshungs pa ste /

original: dpa' bo nyid gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni dkyil 'khor khang par dkyil 'khor bris pa mthong zhing dbang sngon du song bas dkyil 'khor gyi khang par dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sngags pa mchog tu blta ba'am shes par bya ste /

translated: Having become a hero, etc. By this [verse], one should see or know the supreme mantra practitioner who draws the ma·πá·∏çala in the ma·πá·∏çala house, having previously received initiation, as having seen the ma·πá·∏çala drawn in the ma·πá·∏çala house.

original: 'khor lo gsum la gnas pa'i dpa' bo dang 'dra @175b bar gzhan gnon pa'am /üîΩ'dod pa'i don kun sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo gsum la gnas pa'i dpa' bo dang 'dra @175b bar gzhan gnon pa'am / 'dod pa'i don kun sbyin pa ste /
translated: He is like a hero abiding in the three wheels, or else he is like a hero who conquers others.üîΩHe gives all desired aims.

original: lhag ma ni brjod pa'i don nyid do //

original: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma gnyis su med par dgod pa'i cho ga'i le'u bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /

original: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //

original: de nas ni song ba'i don nyid do //
analyzed: de nas ni song ba'i don nyid do //

original: zhi ba ni dge ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhi ba ni dge ba'i don to //

analyzed: thams cad chos 'byung ni ma lus pa'i chos skyed par byed pa'o //

analyzed: chos kun gcig tu bsdus pa ni rang gi rgyud du bsdus pa'i mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams kyi sngags ni sngags pa rnal 'byor pas phyis bri par bya'o //
translated: The mantra of the ·∏çƒÅkas and ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s, etc., who are included in one‚Äôs continuum, which is the condensation of all phenomena, should be written later by the mantra practitioner, the yogi.

original: yang na mi shigs ni aom dang po h'um h'um phat mthar sbyar ba'i a'a li dang k'a li'i sngags ni dge ba'o //

analyzed: de'i rjes su bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka'i rtsa ba'i sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig btu bar bya'o zhes pa'i don nam //

original: thams cad kyi don ni de nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad kyi don ni de nyid do //

original: 'dir sngags tshig ni 'di yin te zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dir sngags tshig ni 'di yin te zhes pa la sogs pa la /

original: de nas gzhan yang sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig yin pa 'dis bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka'i rtsa ba'i sngags btu ba'i cho ga ston te //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig yin pa 'dis bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka'i rtsa ba'i sngags btu ba'i cho ga ston te //

original: a'a li k'a li mnyam byas nas //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li mnyam byas nas //

analyzed: zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: dbyangs dang gsal byed ngag mnyam pa ni 'dra ba'o //

analyzed: sde tshan la thim par bya ba ni sde der ril por byas pa'o //

original: bzhi bzhi ru ni zhes bya ba la ni bzhi dang bzhi ru shes par bya ba'o //üîΩthub pa ni sde tshan bdun du gang gyur pa de ltar byas @176a * //
analyzed: bzhi bzhi ru ni zhes bya ba la ni bzhi dang bzhi ru shes par bya ba'o // thub pa ni sde tshan bdun du gang gyur pa de ltar byas @176a * //

original: la go bzlog pa dang go rims kyis sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig brgyad yang rgyas par bya ba ni btu bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: la go bzlog pa dang go rims kyis sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig brgyad yang rgyas par bya ba ni btu bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The sage is the one who has become in seven classes. Having done that, the eight mantra syllable words are to be extracted by the reverse order and the sequence. The meaning is that they are to be expanded.

original: de nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir //

original: de nas dpa' bo btu bar bya //
analyzed: de nas dpa' bo btu bar bya //

analyzed: 'dod don thams cad sgrub byed yin //

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: 'dir 'di'i dgongs pa ni dang por sngags kyi tshig bzhi bzhir shes par byas la /

original: de nas dpa' bo btu bar bya //
analyzed: de nas dpa' bo btu bar bya //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan bya dang ston pa po dag sku gcig nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa //

analyzed: lnga pa yi ni bzhi pa dang ni bha'o //

original: dang po'i gsum pa gang yin ni ga'o //

original: dpa' bo nyid du yang bstan pa'i phyir rgyud 'dir dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams ldan pa nyid kyis //
analyzed: dpa' bo nyid du yang bstan pa'i phyir rgyud 'dir dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams ldan pa nyid kyis //

original: gcig gi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags su gnas pa des sngon bzhin du dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi nye ba'i snying po'i sngags rnams ni gcig nyid do //
analyzed: gcig gi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags su gnas pa des sngon bzhin du dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi nye ba'i snying po'i sngags rnams ni gcig nyid do //

translated: Or, the single essence mantra of the heroes is not reasonable.

original: pa las grol ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: pa las grol ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: That is not reasonable, because the essence of the tantra that should be followed for the meaning is free from sound and nonsound.

original: bden te 'on kyang le'u brgyad pa dpal he ru ka rdo rje phag mor 'dus shing sbyor ba yang so so'i ngo bo nyid kyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang le'u brgyad pa dpal he ru ka rdo rje phag mor 'dus shing sbyor ba yang so so'i ngo bo nyid kyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags bstan pa'o //

translated: In the previous chapter, the hero and yoginis and the Cakrasamvara yoga also taught the near-essence of the nature of non-Cakrasamvara.

original: le'u 'dir ni dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid kyi snying po'i sngags brjod pa'o //
analyzed: le'u 'dir ni dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid kyi snying po'i sngags brjod pa'o //

original: de ltar tha snyad du gtso bo rjes su 'brang ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad du gtso bo rjes su 'brang ba'i rigs pas so //

original: de la re zhig 'di thams cad dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rtsa bzhi'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags nyid du 'on kyang ji ltar ston no zhes rtsod na don phyogs snga ma'i rjes su sngon du bstan pa'i le'u bzhi par dpa' bo dang rnal 'byorüîΩma rnams rigs gsal bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis lha rnams kyi ming gi mtshan ma dang bcas par snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags rnams gsal bar byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la re zhig 'di thams cad dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rtsa bzhi'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags nyid du 'on kyang ji ltar ston no zhes rtsod na don phyogs snga ma'i rjes su sngon du bstan pa'i le'u bzhi par dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams rigs gsal bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis lha rnams kyi ming gi mtshan ma dang bcas par snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags rnams gsal bar byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: If someone argues that all of this is the mantra of the essence and the quintessence of the heroes and heroines of the four root [tantras], then how is it taught?üîΩThe meaning is that in the previous position, in the fourth chapter taught previously, the heroes and yoginƒ´s are clarified by the nature of the essence and quintessence mantras along with the name-signs of the deities.

original: 'dir ni dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i lha rnams ming gi brdar byas pa med pa'i snying po'i sngags rnams snying po nyid du gsal bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i lha rnams ming gi brdar byas pa med pa'i snying po'i sngags rnams snying po nyid du gsal bar byas pa'i phyir ro //

original: de nyid kyi phyir dz'a landha ra'i zhabs kyis kyang thams cad du sgrub pa la snying po'i sngags rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dz'a landha ra'i zhabs kyis kyang thams cad du sgrub pa la snying po'i sngags rnams kyang ngo //
translated: For that very reason, JƒÅlandhara also says that in all [cases], the essence mantras are for practice.

original: gzhan du ni 'dir lha rnams kyi snying po'i sngags ni 'di'o zhes nges par bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni 'dir lha rnams kyi snying po'i sngags ni 'di'o zhes nges par bya bar mi nus te /
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible to determine that this is the essence-mantra of such-and-such a deity.

original: snying po'i sngags kyis ming brdar byas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snying po'i sngags kyis ming brdar byas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the essence-mantra is not a conventional term.

original: yang na snying po'i sngags la nye ba nyid kyi phyir nye ba'i snying po'i sngags su bsgrubs pas lan du smra ba la phul du phyung ba'i lan ston pa ni lha rnams brdar byas pa dang bral ba'i rigs gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis lha rnams ming gi
analyzed: yang na snying po'i sngags la nye ba nyid kyi phyir nye ba'i snying po'i sngags su bsgrubs pas lan du smra ba la phul du phyung ba'i lan ston pa ni lha rnams brdar byas pa dang bral ba'i rigs gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis lha rnams ming gi
translated: Or else, the essence-mantra is established as the near-essence-mantra because it is near to the essence-mantra. The reply to the question is taught as the best reply. The reply is the best because the deities are free from conventional terms, and the nature of the deities is clear.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags kyi tshig rigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags kyi tshig rigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: de ltar phul du byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis de yongs su spong ba'i rtsod pa smra ba rnams ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar phul du byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis de yongs su spong ba'i rtsod pa smra ba rnams ni rigs pa ma yin te /

original: le'u drug pa las gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis dpa' bo drug mnyam par sbyor ba'i yi ge @178b re rer yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: le'u drug pa las gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis dpa' bo drug mnyam par sbyor ba'i yi ge @178b re rer yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the teaching in the sixth chapter of the essence of the six heroes in union with the six heroines, each syllable is perfectly taught.

analyzed: gal te yang na dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa dpa' bo drug gi go cha la sogs pa gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //

original: de la lan brjod pa med pa ni ma yin te /

analyzed: mkha' 'gro rnal 'byor ma rnams dang // khanda ro ha l'a ma sogs //
translated: Khandaroha, LƒÅmƒÅ, and so forth,

analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni thams cad kyi //

original: zhes rab tu grub pa nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'gro ma thams cad kyi snying po'i sngags nyid du rab tu grub bo //

original: @179a * // gal te yang na nyung ba dang mang ba'i yi ge la snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags kyi tshig tu nges pas yi ge mang po'i don nyid kyis de snying po nyid du thams cad ma 'thob pa las nye ba'i snying po 'thob par 'gyur ba'am
analyzed: @179a * // gal te yang na nyung ba dang mang ba'i yi ge la snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags kyi tshig tu nges pas yi ge mang po'i don nyid kyis de snying po nyid du thams cad ma 'thob pa las nye ba'i snying po 'thob par 'gyur ba'am
translated: If, on the other hand, the mantra syllables of the essence and the near essence are definitely determined by the number of syllables, then the meaning of the many syllables is the essence itself, and everything is not obtained from the near essence.

original: // rig pa'i rgyal po'i snying po zhes bya ba'i cho ga'i don du'o //
analyzed: // rig pa'i rgyal po'i snying po zhes bya ba'i cho ga'i don du'o //
translated: Or, the meaning of the term ‚Äúking of knowledge‚Äù is for the sake of the ritual.

original: yang na ni yi ge mang po'i sngags kyi tshig kyang snying por 'gyur bas /
analyzed: yang na ni yi ge mang po'i sngags kyi tshig kyang snying por 'gyur bas /
translated: Or, the mantra syllables of many syllables are also the essence.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The king of knowledge is also for the sake of the object of attainment.

original: gang nye ba'i snying po dang snying po'i sngags dag ngo bo nyid du mtshungs par bsgrub par bya ba'i don du rig pa'i rgyal po'i snying po nyid du thams cad du bya'o //
analyzed: gang nye ba'i snying po dang snying po'i sngags dag ngo bo nyid du mtshungs par bsgrub par bya ba'i don du rig pa'i rgyal po'i snying po nyid du thams cad du bya'o //
translated: In order to establish that the essence and the essence mantra are the same in nature, everything should be made into the essence of the king of knowledge.

original: gal te re zhig 'di thams cad 'dir bsdus pas mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur sngon du song ba las he ru ka dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i snying po gsal bar bstan pa yin no zhe na /

translated: If it is argued that since everything is included here, the essence of the hero Heruka and the yoginƒ´ is clearly taught from the prior worship and service,

original: dpal ldan khrag 'thung sngags shes na //
analyzed: dpal ldan khrag 'thung sngags shes na //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang mi mthun pa dang 'di thams cad nyid mthun pa ma yin no //

original: dpal he ru ka nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: It is the glorious Heruka who is indicated.

original: de re zhig zhog gis 'khor lo gsum la gnas pa'i dpa' bo dang dpa' mo bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad dang mkha' 'gro ma bco brgyad gang yang tha dad pa'i gzugs kyis 'dir snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags bstan pa'o //üîΩgal te de ltar yang mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur sngon du 'gro ba las rtsa ba'i sngags 'di bsdus pas /
analyzed: de re zhig zhog gis 'khor lo gsum la gnas pa'i dpa' bo dang dpa' mo bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad dang mkha' 'gro ma bco brgyad gang yang tha dad pa'i gzugs kyis 'dir snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags bstan pa'o // gal te de ltar yang mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur sngon du 'gro ba las rtsa ba'i sngags 'di bsdus pas /
translated: Now, let that be. The root mantra is taught here in the form of the essence and quintessence mantras of the forty-eight heroes and heroines abiding in the three wheels and the eighteen dakinis.

original: de'i yang rtsa ba'i sngags nyid yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad ci'i phyir yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i yang rtsa ba'i sngags nyid yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad ci'i phyir yin zhe na /

original: mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ni //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn says, The hero who is the nature of all dakinis,

analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das la 'di nyid kyi phyir brjod pa'o //

analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ni de yang 'khor lo gsum pa la sogs pa la gnas pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das las gzhan ma yin pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: The hero who is the nature of all dakinis is also said to be none other than the BhagavƒÅn because he abides in the three wheels and so forth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i sdom bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i sdom bcom ldan 'das so //

translated: For this very reason, he is called the king of knowledge, etc. , because the object of instruction and the instructor are nondual.

analyzed: de ma lus pas khyad par du byed do //

original: zhes pa ni brgyad cu rtsa gnyis pa la a'a sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni brgyad cu rtsa gnyis pa la a'a sbyar ba'o //
translated: This is the eighty-second [A].

original: 'di ni rtsa ba'i sngags su zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: 'di ni rtsa ba'i sngags su zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: The root mantra, etc.

original: rtsa ba ni gtso bo ste sbas pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: rtsa ba ni gtso bo ste sbas pa'i sngags so //
translated: The root is the principal, the hidden mantra.

original: khyad par du rtsa ba'i sngags la gnas pas //
analyzed: khyad par du rtsa ba'i sngags la gnas pas //
translated: In particular, it is the root mantra, abiding in the supreme, the principal, the heroes, etc.

original: bi du skad kyi dbyings las don mang ba'i phyir mchog tu byed pas na gtso bo ste dpal he ru ka la sogs pa'i dpa' bo rnams zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bi du skad kyi dbyings las don mang ba'i phyir mchog tu byed pas na gtso bo ste dpal he ru ka la sogs pa'i dpa' bo rnams zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word vidu has many meanings, and because it is supreme, it is the principal, the heroes, the glorious Heruka, etc.

original: khyad par ci lta bu zhes pa la //
analyzed: khyad par ci lta bu zhes pa la //
translated: What is the special feature?

original: gnas pa yin zhing dngos grub thams cad kyi gzhi ste dpal khrag 'thung la sogs dpa' bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa yin zhing dngos grub thams cad kyi gzhi ste dpal khrag 'thung la sogs dpa' bo zhes bya'o //
translated: It is abiding, the basis of all powers, the heroes, the glorious Heruka, etc.

original: yang ji lta bu'i dngos grub kyi khyad du gyur ba zhes pa la /üîΩmkha' 'gro ma yi snying 'joms yin //
analyzed: yang ji lta bu'i dngos grub kyi khyad du gyur ba zhes pa la / mkha' 'gro ma yi snying 'joms yin //
translated: Again, what is the special feature of the power?

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is the killer of the dakinis' hearts.

original: 'di brjod pa tsam gyis mkha' 'gro ma kun 'jigs par byed cing de dang snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di brjod pa tsam gyis mkha' 'gro ma kun 'jigs par byed cing de dang snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: By merely uttering this, all the dakinis are terrified and enter into union with him.üîΩSince he destroys the heart of the dakinis, he is glorious Heruka. By uttering the mantra of the king of knowledge in the form of the play of glorious Heruka and so forth, he is accomplished.

original: gang gi phyir mkha' 'gro ma'i snying 'joms pas dpal he ru ka lha nyid brjod pas grub pa ste dpal he ru ka rol pa la sogs pa'i gzugs rig pa'i rgyal po'i sngags brjod pas grub pa don yod pa bzlas pa tsam gyis dngos grub sbyin zhes pa'i
analyzed: gang gi phyir mkha' 'gro ma'i snying 'joms pas dpal he ru ka lha nyid brjod pas grub pa ste dpal he ru ka rol pa la sogs pa'i gzugs rig pa'i rgyal po'i sngags brjod pas grub pa don yod pa bzlas pa tsam gyis dngos grub sbyin zhes pa'i
translated: The meaning is that by merely reciting the mantra, he grants spiritual powers.

original: don to // aom ni dang por sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: don to // aom ni dang por sbyar bar bya //
translated: Om is to be applied at the beginning,

original: h'um h'um phat ni mthar sbyar ba //
analyzed: h'um h'um phat ni mthar sbyar ba //
translated: hum hum phat at the end.

original: zhes pa ni shin tu rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni shin tu rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: This is the fruit of perfection.

original: aom dang po h'um h'um phat mthar sbyar ba ni phreng ba'i sngags zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: aom dang po h'um h'um phat mthar sbyar ba ni phreng ba'i sngags zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the garland mantra is om at the beginning, hum hum phat at the end.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i sngags btu ba'i le'u bdun pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i sngags btu ba'i le'u bdun pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary to the seventh chapter on the selection of the mantras of the Shri Herukabhidhana.

original: // / de nas zhes pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: // / de nas zhes pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Then is easy to understand.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyi /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyi /
translated: Of his own nature.

original: dpa' bo thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: dpa' bo thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The union of all heroes,

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba'i sngom //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba'i sngom //
translated: the binding of the dakinis' net.üîΩThis is the essence of the essence of the glorious Heruka, the mantra wheel, etc.,

original: zhes pa ni dpal he ru ka'i bdag nyid kyi yang snying dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags 'khor lo gsum la sogs pa la rnam par @183a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dpal he ru ka'i bdag nyid kyi yang snying dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags 'khor lo gsum la sogs pa la rnam par @183a * //
translated: the dakas and dakinis abiding in the three wheels, etc.,

original: gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma thams cad rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma thams cad rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: in their natural state.üîΩThe essence mantra is taught in reverse order, with svaha, etc.,

original: sv'a h'a la sogs pas go rims bzlog nas bstan pa'i snying po sngags yi ge nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa 'di dang / go rims ni aom shr'i badzra he he ru ru kam hum h'um phat /
analyzed: sv'a h'a la sogs pas go rims bzlog nas bstan pa'i snying po sngags yi ge nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa 'di dang / go rims ni aom shr'i badzra he he ru ru kam hum h'um phat /
translated: as Om shrim vajra heru heruka hum hum phat,

original: d'a ki n'i dz'a la samba ram sv'a h'a zhes bya'o //
analyzed: d'a ki n'i dz'a la samba ram sv'a h'a zhes bya'o //
translated: dakini jalam samvaram svaha.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po'i snying po ni //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po'i snying po ni //
translated: The essence of the king of knowledge

original: ma byung 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byung 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: has not arisen and will not arise.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sngags kyi bdag nyid che bar bstan no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sngags kyi bdag nyid che bar bstan no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This teaches the greatness of the mantra nature.

original: phat la sogs pa yang de bzhin du go rims bzlog pa ni /
analyzed: phat la sogs pa yang de bzhin du go rims bzlog pa ni /
translated: Phat, etc., is also in reverse order.

original: rnal 'byor ma ni drug tu bstan //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni drug tu bstan //
translated: The meaning is that the essence mantra is the six syllables o·πÉ, ƒÅ·∏•, h≈´·πÉ, pha·πÉ, ya·πÉ, and mo·πÉ, which are the six yoginƒ´s.üîΩThe meaning is that the essence mantra is the six syllables o·πÉ, ƒÅ·∏•, h≈´·πÉ, pha·πÉ, ya·πÉ, and mo·πÉ, which are the six yoginƒ´s.

original: zhes pa'i don to //üîΩaom badzra bee ro tsa n'i ye hu h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni 'dir nye ba'i snying po gang yin pa dngos su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //üîΩaom badzra bee ro tsa n'i ye hu h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni 'dir nye ba'i snying po gang yin pa dngos su bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the essence mantra is the six syllables o·πÉ,

original: yang na sngon gyi rjes su 'brang bas rnal 'byor ma drug gi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags kyi tshig tu gzung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sngon gyi rjes su 'brang bas rnal 'byor ma drug gi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags kyi tshig tu gzung ba'o //
translated: Or else, because it follows the past, it is held to be the mantra words of the essence and the quintessence of the six yoginis.

original: yang gzugs dgod pa ni sgrub thabs las gsungs pa'i rim pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang gzugs dgod pa ni sgrub thabs las gsungs pa'i rim pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the arrangement of the forms is just the sequence taught in the sadhana. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi rig pa che //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi rig pa che //
translated: The knowledge of the dakinis is great.

original: ma byung 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byung 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It did not exist before and will not exist in the future.

original: zhes pa 'dis ni sngags kyi che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis ni sngags kyi che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the greatness of the mantra.

original: sa steng na ni rin chen bzhi //
analyzed: sa steng na ni rin chen bzhi //
translated: On the surface of the earth, there are four jewels.

original: phreng ba'i sngags ni dam pa yin //
analyzed: phreng ba'i sngags ni dam pa yin //
translated: The mantra garland is supreme.

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi rig pa che //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi rig pa che //
translated: The knowledge of the dakinis is great.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po he ru ka / sa yi dkyil 'khor mchog tu brjod //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po he ru ka / sa yi dkyil 'khor mchog tu brjod //
translated: The knowledge king Heruka is declared to be supreme in the mandala of the earth.

original: ces pa ni sngags rgyud rnams nas rin po che bzhi ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni sngags rgyud rnams nas rin po che bzhi ste /
translated: In the mantra tantras, the four jewels are

original: sngags bzhi la rin po che bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngags bzhi la rin po che bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: the four mantras, which are called the four jewels.

original: sogs pas ni ci lta ba nyid kyi don du gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pas ni ci lta ba nyid kyi don du gzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. is taken in the sense of just as.

original: de nas 'di'i don ni bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma'i phreng ba'i sngags nyid dang snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i rnams sam /
analyzed: de nas 'di'i don ni bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma'i phreng ba'i sngags nyid dang snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i rnams sam /
translated: Now, the meaning of this is that it is the mantra of the garland of the Blessed One and the Blessed One's consort, or the essence and close essence mantras,

original: dpa' bo drug dang dpa' mo drug gi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i @183b sngags so //üîΩsangs rgyas thams cad kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags kyi tshig rkang bzhi yin pa'am /
analyzed: dpa' bo drug dang dpa' mo drug gi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i @183b sngags so // sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags kyi tshig rkang bzhi yin pa'am /
translated: or the essence and close essence mantras of the six heroes and six heroines.üîΩIt is the four-line mantra of the dakinis of all the buddhas,

original: phyogs bcing ba'i sngags kyi tshig rkang bzhi yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcing ba'i sngags kyi tshig rkang bzhi yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: or the four-line mantra of binding the directions.

original: sngags ni tshig rkang bzhi 'byor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngags ni tshig rkang bzhi 'byor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mantra is four lines long.

original: ha lnga yang dpal he ru ka'i snying po dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ci lta ba'i sgra'i rkyen bstan pa las don dam gyi stobs kyis dpags la go bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ha lnga yang dpal he ru ka'i snying po dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ci lta ba'i sgra'i rkyen bstan pa las don dam gyi stobs kyis dpags la go bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The five ha's are similar to the essence of glorious Heruka, so the meaning should be understood by inference through the power of the ultimate, as indicated by the word like.

original: khyad par rig pa'i rgyal po dang rtsa ba'i sngags ni bzhi bzhi'i tshig ni rin po cher gyur ba gang yin pa ni rnal 'byor ba'i gang 'dod pa de thams cad byed do //
analyzed: khyad par rig pa'i rgyal po dang rtsa ba'i sngags ni bzhi bzhi'i tshig ni rin po cher gyur ba gang yin pa ni rnal 'byor ba'i gang 'dod pa de thams cad byed do //
translated: In particular, the king of knowledge mantras and the root mantras, each with four syllables, are jewels, and whatever the yogin desires, all that they do.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir dga' ba skyed pas rin po che'i ngo bo nyid kyi sngags te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir dga' ba skyed pas rin po che'i ngo bo nyid kyi sngags te /
translated: For this very reason, the mantras are of the nature of jewels, since they generate joy.

original: yid bzhin nor bu rin po che'i phreng ba lta bu 'dis 'dod pa'i don sbyin par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu rin po che'i phreng ba lta bu 'dis 'dod pa'i don sbyin par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Since they grant the desired aim, like a garland of wish-fulfilling jewels.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: rig pa'i rgyal po'i las kyi mchog //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po'i las kyi mchog //
translated: the king of knowledge mantras is the supreme activity.

original: ces bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ste /
translated: It is said.

original: de'i stobs kyis rig pa'i rgyal po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis rig pa'i rgyal po zhes brjod do //
translated: By the power of that, it is called the king of knowledge mantras.

original: phreng ba'i sngags su mngon par brjod pa la rtsa ba'i sngags so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phreng ba'i sngags su mngon par brjod pa la rtsa ba'i sngags so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: In the expression of the garland mantra, it means the root mantra.

original: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa las phyin ci log gi rnal 'byor ma drug gis bsdu ba'i cho ga'i le'u brgyan pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa las phyin ci log gi rnal 'byor ma drug gis bsdu ba'i cho ga'i le'u brgyan pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the chapter on the procedure of the collection by the six inverted yoginis from the Sri Heruka Tantra.

original: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de nas ni go sla'o //
analyzed: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de nas ni go sla'o //
translated: Then, etc. Then is easy to understand.

original: bshad bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bshad bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It should be explained, etc.

original: de ci zhes pa la las kyi tshogs sna tshogs pa'i mthu la sogs pa dang / mchog tu gyur ba'i gtso bo'i rtsa ba'i sngags dang / rig pa'i rgyal po'i sngags ci lta ba bzhin du ci lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi sngon du 'gro bas rim pa bzhin du zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ci zhes pa la las kyi tshogs sna tshogs pa'i mthu la sogs pa dang / mchog tu gyur ba'i gtso bo'i rtsa ba'i sngags dang / rig pa'i rgyal po'i sngags ci lta ba bzhin du ci lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi sngon du 'gro bas rim pa bzhin du zhes pa'i don to //
translated: What is that? The power of the various collections of karma, and the supreme principal root mantra, and the mantra of the king of awarenesses, just as they are, by the nature of the preliminaries, in due order, is the meaning of just as.

original: 'jig rten gsum zhes pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum zhes pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The three worlds is easy to understand.

original: skye gnas thams cad ces pa ni /
analyzed: skye gnas thams cad ces pa ni /
translated: All wombs is

original: yang dngos grub kyi tshig ni rgyud thams cad du zlos pa'i skyon med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dngos grub kyi tshig ni rgyud thams cad du zlos pa'i skyon med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The words of attainment are faultless in all tantras.

original: sprin rnams 'thor bar byed ces pa ni dang po ni don ji lta ba nyid du gzung ngo //
analyzed: sprin rnams 'thor bar byed ces pa ni dang po ni don ji lta ba nyid du gzung ngo //
translated: It scatters the clouds, the first is taken just as the meaning.

original: de'i rjes su 'di'i don ni rdo rje padma mnyam par sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su mkha' 'gro ma rnams dbang du byed pa'o //üîΩchar 'bebs par byed pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyi chu'i rgyun 'bebs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'di'i don ni rdo rje padma mnyam par sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su mkha' 'gro ma rnams dbang du byed pa'o // char 'bebs par byed pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyi chu'i rgyun 'bebs par byed pa'o //
translated: After that, the meaning is that the dakinis are brought under control in the situation of the union of the vajra and lotus.üîΩThe rainmaker is the one who causes the stream of bodhicitta to fall.

original: zlog par byed pa ni gnas par byed pa'o //üîΩrgya @184a * //
analyzed: zlog par byed pa ni gnas par byed pa'o // rgya @184a * //
translated: The turner back is the one who causes the bodhicitta to remain.

original: mtsho skems par byed pa ni phyag rgya dang lhan cig tu yan lag gis gnas pa ni de skems pa ste zhi ba'i gnas skabs su byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtsho skems par byed pa ni phyag rgya dang lhan cig tu yan lag gis gnas pa ni de skems pa ste zhi ba'i gnas skabs su byed pa'o //
translated: The drier of the ocean is the one who dries up the ocean by means of the union with the consort, that is, by means of the state of peace.

original: chu bo rgyun phyogs las bzlog nas 'bab par ston pa ni byang chub kyi sems 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: chu bo rgyun phyogs las bzlog nas 'bab par ston pa ni byang chub kyi sems 'gog pa'o //
translated: The one who causes the river to flow upstream is the one who stops the bodhicitta.

original: dbang po zlog par byed pa ni khros pa brgyud pa'i dbang po 'ching bar byed pa'o //üîΩsa g-yo bar byed pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po zlog par byed pa ni khros pa brgyud pa'i dbang po 'ching bar byed pa'o // sa g-yo bar byed pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The one who turns back the senses is the one who binds the senses of the angry one.

original: sems can che ba las kyang che bar gyur pa skyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can che ba las kyang che bar gyur pa skyod par byed pa'o //
translated: The earth shaker is the one who shakes the great beings.

original: shing las 'jogs te gang 'dod pa der 'gro bar byed do zhes pa ni rig pa ni sdong po ste de yod pas nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing las 'jogs te gang 'dod pa der 'gro bar byed do zhes pa ni rig pa ni sdong po ste de yod pas nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should make a doll out of the bark of a tree, and he will go wherever one wishes.

original: sngags thams cad kyi nus pa 'phrog par byed pa ni 'jig rten gsum na gang cung zad gnas pa'i gsang bar brjod pa de thams cad 'khrul 'khor la zhon nas de ltar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sngags thams cad kyi nus pa 'phrog par byed pa ni 'jig rten gsum na gang cung zad gnas pa'i gsang bar brjod pa de thams cad 'khrul 'khor la zhon nas de ltar brjod pa'o //
translated: The one who steals the power of all mantras is one who, mounted on a machine, speaks all the secret expressions that exist in the three worlds.

original: dngos grub thams cad 'phrog par byed do zhes pa ni rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa thams cad dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de thams cad 'phrog pa ste len pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad 'phrog par byed do zhes pa ni rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa thams cad dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de thams cad 'phrog pa ste len pa'o //
translated: The one who steals all powers is the one who steals all the powers of all the vidyƒÅdharas and so forth.

original: khrag 'dren par byed pa zhes pa ni bsrung ba mang po dang ldan pa'i rgyal po dang 'brel ba yin yang 'gugs pa'o //
analyzed: khrag 'dren par byed pa zhes pa ni bsrung ba mang po dang ldan pa'i rgyal po dang 'brel ba yin yang 'gugs pa'o //
translated: The one who draws blood is the one who summons even a king who is protected by many protections.

original: slar gtong bar byed pa ni rang gnas su 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: slar gtong bar byed pa ni rang gnas su 'jog pa'o //
translated: The one who sends back is the one who places him in his own place.üîΩ üîΩThe one who makes invisible is the one who makes invisible all the things that are connected to him.üîΩ The one who makes visible is the one who makes visible all the things that are connected to him.üîΩ The one who makes one fly is the one who makes one fly up into the sky.üîΩ The one who makes one fall is the one who makes one fall down from there.üîΩ The one who makes one invisible is the one who makes one invisible to all beings.üîΩ The one who makes one visible is the one who makes one visible to all beings.üîΩ The one who makes one young again is the one who makes one young again, even if one is old.üîΩ The one who makes one old is the one who makes one old, even if one is young.üîΩ The one who makes one beautiful is the one who makes one beautiful, even if one is ugly.üîΩ The one who makes one ugly is the one who makes one ugly, even if one is beautiful.üîΩ The one who makes one poor is the one who makes one poor, even if one is rich.üîΩ The one who makes one rich is the one who makes one rich, even if one is poor.üîΩ The one who makes one a slave is the one who makes one a slave, even if one is a king.üîΩ The one who makes one a king is the one who makes one a king, even if one is a slave.üîΩ The one who makes one a woman is the one who makes one a woman, even if one is a man.üîΩ The one who makes one a man is the one who makes one a man, even if one is a woman.üîΩ The one who makes one a neuter is the

original: gzugs brgya stong du mar byed do zhes pa ni ma lus pa'i sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir rang gi thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa las de'i rnam pa can gyis ma lus pa'i nam mkha' khyab par sngags dang lha spro ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs brgya stong du mar byed do zhes pa ni ma lus pa'i sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir rang gi thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa las de'i rnam pa can gyis ma lus pa'i nam mkha' khyab par sngags dang lha spro ba'o //
translated: He creates hundreds of thousands of forms means that, in order to benefit all sentient beings, he emanates mantras and deities in the form of all things, pervading the entire sky with his own method and wisdom.

original: 'dod na snang bar byed cing 'dod na mi snang bar byed do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod na snang bar byed cing 'dod na mi snang bar byed do zhes pa ni /
translated: If he wishes, he makes himself visible; if he wishes, he makes himself invisible.

original: lha mo rnams ji ltar 'dod pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lha mo rnams ji ltar 'dod pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the goddesses do as he wishes.

original: khang bzangs dang shing gi rtse mo la sogs pa phye mar byed do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: khang bzangs dang shing gi rtse mo la sogs pa phye mar byed do zhes pa ni /
translated: He reduces mansions, treetops, and so on to dust.

original: khang bzangs ni padma ste sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khang bzangs ni padma ste sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A mansion is a lotus, because it is taught that all buddhas are equal.

original: sdong po ni rdo rje ste rdo rje ni skyes bu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sdong po ni rdo rje ste rdo rje ni skyes bu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: A tree trunk is a vajra, because a vajra is a man.

original: rtse mo ni lha mo rnams kyi padma'i ze 'bru ste /
analyzed: rtse mo ni lha mo rnams kyi padma'i ze 'bru ste /
translated: A treetop is the anthers of the goddesses' lotuses.

original: tha ma dang 'bring dang rab rnams la 'dod pas rdo rje padma gnyis bskyod pas ltos pa med pas brdung zhes pa'i don to //üîΩdug bdud rtsir byed do zhes pa ni dug bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar bstan no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tha ma dang 'bring dang rab rnams la 'dod pas rdo rje padma gnyis bskyod pas ltos pa med pas brdung zhes pa'i don to // dug bdud rtsir byed do zhes pa ni dug bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar bstan no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbeat‚Äù is that one should not be concerned with the inferior, middling, and superior.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúmake poison into ambrosia‚Äù is that one should make poison like ambrosia.

original: bdud rtsi yang dug tu byed do zhes pa ni bdud rtsi dang 'dra ba'i yul @184b yang du ga bzhin du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi yang dug tu byed do zhes pa ni bdud rtsi dang 'dra ba'i yul @184b yang du ga bzhin du spyod pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmake ambrosia into poison‚Äù is that one should enjoy objects that are like ambrosia as if they were poison.

original: shin tu chags par mi byed ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu chags par mi byed ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdo not be very attached‚Äù is that one should not be attached to the objects of desire.

original: zla ba chur byed pa ni byang chub kyi sems 'o ma bzhin du 'thung bar byed do //
analyzed: zla ba chur byed pa ni byang chub kyi sems 'o ma bzhin du 'thung bar byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúMake the moon into milk‚Äù means that one should drink the bodhicitta as if it were milk.

original: chu zla bar byed do zhes pa ni chu zla ba dang 'dra bar slong ba ste /
analyzed: chu zla bar byed do zhes pa ni chu zla ba dang 'dra bar slong ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMake water into the moon‚Äù means that one should give water to a beggar as if it were the moon.

original: de bzhin du zla ba'i btung ba bzhin du myong bar byed ces pa'i don to //üîΩdri thams cad 'phrog par byed do zhes pa ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba'i btung ba bzhin du myong bar byed ces pa'i don to // dri thams cad 'phrog par byed do zhes pa ni //
translated: The meaning is that one should enjoy it as if it were the drink of the moon.

original: bdud rtsi rnam pa lnga'i dri 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi rnam pa lnga'i dri 'phrog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTake away all smells‚Äù means that one should take away the smell of the five ambrosias.

original: gang du 'dod pa der 'pho bar byed do zhes pa ni de'i dri gzhan bram ze la sogs pa'i zas la 'pho bar byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang du 'dod pa der 'pho bar byed do zhes pa ni de'i dri gzhan bram ze la sogs pa'i zas la 'pho bar byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: One should transfer it to wherever one wishes means that one should transfer it to the food of others, such as Brahmins.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir legs par bstan pa'i don gsal bar byed pa ni nam mkha' lding gi gdong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir legs par bstan pa'i don gsal bar byed pa ni nam mkha' lding gi gdong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For this very reason, the meaning of the well-taught is clarified by like the face of the king of birds, and so forth.

original: nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po'i gdong bzhin du 'gro ba 'byin par byed ces pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po'i gdong bzhin du 'gro ba 'byin par byed ces pa ni /
translated: It is said, One should emit beings like the face of the king of birds.

original: nam mkha' la 'gro 'dod pa'i bya khyung ni gshog pa gnyis skyong bar byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro 'dod pa'i bya khyung ni gshog pa gnyis skyong bar byed do //
translated: A garu·∏ça king, desiring to fly in the sky, flaps its two wings.

original: gang ji lta bu zhi ba'i 'dus pa la bud med rnams dang gang mnyam par sbyor ba ni khams byang chub kyi sems blangs te lha mo'i zhal du sbyin par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang ji lta bu zhi ba'i 'dus pa la bud med rnams dang gang mnyam par sbyor ba ni khams byang chub kyi sems blangs te lha mo'i zhal du sbyin par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: One who is like that, in whatever assembly, with whomsoever, with whom one engages in union, takes the bodhicitta element and offers it into the mouth of the goddess.

original: yang na gzhung gzhan te gdong gtso bor gyur pa ni bya khyung gi gdong ste bya rnams las bya khyung gi gdong gtso bor gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na gzhung gzhan te gdong gtso bor gyur pa ni bya khyung gi gdong ste bya rnams las bya khyung gi gdong gtso bor gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the other text, ‚Äúthe face of the garu·∏ça is foremost,‚Äù is because the face of the garu·∏ça is foremost among birds.

original: des khyad par can gyi cho gas 'gro ba rtogs par gnas par byed pa ni gnas pa ste /
analyzed: des khyad par can gyi cho gas 'gro ba rtogs par gnas par byed pa ni gnas pa ste /
translated: It makes the world understand through its special characteristics, so it is a place.

original: ji ltar 'gro 'dod pa'i bya khyung gshog pa gnyis skyong bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro 'dod pa'i bya khyung gshog pa gnyis skyong bar byed do //
translated: Just as a garu·∏ça, desiring to go, flaps its two wings.

original: de lta bur zhi ba'i 'dus pa lha mo rnams dang gang mnyam par spyod cing gdong gis sbrang rtsi blangs nas lha mo'i kha ru ster ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur zhi ba'i 'dus pa lha mo rnams dang gang mnyam par spyod cing gdong gis sbrang rtsi blangs nas lha mo'i kha ru ster ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: In that way, the assembly of peaceful ones is equal to the goddesses, and with its face it takes the honey and gives it to the mouths of the goddesses.

original: mi'i mchog ces pa ni mi gang de ltar spyod pa ni de 'jig rten gsum gyi gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mi'i mchog ces pa ni mi gang de ltar spyod pa ni de 'jig rten gsum gyi gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The supreme human is the human who acts in that way, the chief of the three worlds.

original: 'dis ni bya khyung gi gdong dang 'gro ba 'byin pas zhes pa'i gzhung gzhan ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni bya khyung gi gdong dang 'gro ba 'byin pas zhes pa'i gzhung gzhan ni go sla'o //
translated: This other text, ‚Äúthe face of the garu·∏ça, the producer of going,‚Äù is easy to understand.

original: de'i lag pa'i mthil na yod pa'i dpal gang gis kyang 'phrog par mi nus zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de'i lag pa'i mthil na yod pa'i dpal gang gis kyang 'phrog par mi nus zhes pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the statement that the glory which is in the palm of his hand cannot be taken away by anyone is as follows.

original: de ltar gyur ba'i rnal 'byor pa 'dod cing sprul pa la rgyal ba thams cad kyis kyang dgag par mi nus zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba'i rnal 'byor pa 'dod cing sprul pa la rgyal ba thams cad kyis kyang dgag par mi nus zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the yogin who is such, and who desires and emanates, cannot be stopped even by all the victors.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas gzung ste don ji lta ba de ltar phul du byung ba nyid du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdur khrod kyi sol ba zhes pa'i don @185a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas gzung ste don ji lta ba de ltar phul du byung ba nyid du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro // dur khrod kyi sol ba zhes pa'i don @185a * //
translated: As it is said, just so, up to the meaning of just so, it is because of the presence of excellence.

original: gyi gdams ngag brjod par bya ste /üîΩba ru ra'i sdong bo'i lho phyogs kyi yal ga gtum mo'i sta re la sogs pas bcad nas nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes bcu bzhi'i nub mo dur khrod du bsregs la bong bu'i chus me bsad la //
analyzed: gyi gdams ngag brjod par bya ste / ba ru ra'i sdong bo'i lho phyogs kyi yal ga gtum mo'i sta re la sogs pas bcad nas nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes bcu bzhi'i nub mo dur khrod du bsregs la bong bu'i chus me bsad la //
translated: The meaning of the instruction on the charnel ground ash should be stated.

original: de'i sol pa dang thal bar byas la /
analyzed: de'i sol pa dang thal bar byas la /
translated: Having cut the southern branch of the banyan tree with the axe of fierce anger, on the night of the fourteenth of the dark fortnight, one should burn it in the charnel ground, extinguish the fire with the water of a donkey, and make it into ash.

original: gang de ltar mchog tu khyad par can gyi sol bas phyis kyi dus su rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga byas na de'i 'bras bu bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: gang de ltar mchog tu khyad par can gyi sol bas phyis kyi dus su rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga byas na de'i 'bras bu bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: If one does the rite from the Tantra in that way with the most excellent charcoal, one cannot avert its result.

original: aa ti mug ta'i lcug ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: aa ti mug ta'i lcug ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With the sprouts of atƒ´mukta, etc.üîΩ There, the mantra of the instruction for this is recited one hundred thousand times. The reciter, at the time of the eclipse of the moon, having recited ten thousand [times] at the root of the atƒ´mukta, sits on top of that, visualizing protection, etc.

original: de la 'di'i man ngag gi sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzlas pa'i sngags pas zla ba gzas gzung ba'i dus su aa ti mug ta'i rtsa bar khri bcas la de'i steng du bsdad la bsrung pa la sogs pa dmigs la gzhon nu mas bka' ba'i skud pa dmar po
analyzed: de la 'di'i man ngag gi sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzlas pa'i sngags pas zla ba gzas gzung ba'i dus su aa ti mug ta'i rtsa bar khri bcas la de'i steng du bsdad la bsrung pa la sogs pa dmigs la gzhon nu mas bka' ba'i skud pa dmar po
translated: A young girl spins red thread

original: byas la / nub phyogs kyi char son pa'i yal ga de la skud pas dkris te /
analyzed: byas la / nub phyogs kyi char son pa'i yal ga de la skud pas dkris te /
translated: and wraps the branch that has gone in the western direction with the thread.

original: phyogs gcig tu skra grol ba'i sngags pas gzas gzung ba nas brtsams te btang gi bar du de'i yal ga lag pa g-yon pas gzung la rgyun chad par bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu skra grol ba'i sngags pas gzas gzung ba nas brtsams te btang gi bar du de'i yal ga lag pa g-yon pas gzung la rgyun chad par bzlas par bya'o //
translated: The reciter, with loose hair in one place, starting from the eclipse up to the release, holds the branch with the left hand and recites continuously.

original: phyis kyi dus su mtshon chas bcad la ji ltar gsungs pa'i cho ga bzhin bya ste /
analyzed: phyis kyi dus su mtshon chas bcad la ji ltar gsungs pa'i cho ga bzhin bya ste /
translated: Later, one should cut with a weapon, as stated in the rite.

original: rtse mo dang rtsa bas nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: rtse mo dang rtsa bas nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The peak and the root are illustrated.

original: rtse mos ni 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: rtse mos ni 'ong ba'o //
translated: The peak is the coming.

original: rtsa bas ni phyir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa bas ni phyir 'gro ba'o //
translated: The root is the going out.

original: lhag mas ni song ba'i don nyid do //
analyzed: lhag mas ni song ba'i don nyid do //
translated: The rest is the meaning of the gone.

original: zas skom la sogs ro yis ni //
analyzed: zas skom la sogs ro yis ni //
translated: With food and drink, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sgrub pa po rnyed par sla ba thams cad brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sgrub pa po rnyed par sla ba thams cad brjod pa'o //
translated: and so forth, all the easy attainments are stated.

original: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i rtsa ba'i sngags kyi las tshogs kyi cho ga'i le'u dgu ba'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i rtsa ba'i sngags kyi las tshogs kyi cho ga'i le'u dgu ba'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary to the ninth chapter on the rite of the root mantra of Sri Heruka's recitation, the rite of karma.

original: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Then, etc. is easy to understand.

original: chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni srub po po'i sku gsum gyi rnam gzhag ston te /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni srub po po'i sku gsum gyi rnam gzhag ston te /
translated: By Dharma, etc. the arrangement of the three bodies of the adept is taught.

original: de la 'di'i man ngag ni h'um gcig las rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo gsum la sogs par gnas pa'i gnas skabs ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de la 'di'i man ngag ni h'um gcig las rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo gsum la sogs par gnas pa'i gnas skabs ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: There, the instruction here is that the occasion of the three wheels, etc. complete from one hum is the emanation body.

original: mang po kun lus la gcig tu bsdus te go cha thams cad la sogs pas go bgos nas bzlas pa'i gnas skabs thams cad ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: mang po kun lus la gcig tu bsdus te go cha thams cad la sogs pas go bgos nas bzlas pa'i gnas skabs thams cad ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: Having gathered all the many bodies into one, and having put on all the armor, etc., all the occasions of repetition are the Enjoyment Body.

original: de'i rjes su snying gar padma dang zla ba la a'a li dang k'a li spro ba dang bsdu ba @185b la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su snying gar padma dang zla ba la a'a li dang k'a li spro ba dang bsdu ba @185b la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, the occasion of the emanation and gathering of the vowels and consonants on the moon and lotus in the heart is called the Dharma Body.

original: rim dang rim min ma yin pas //
analyzed: rim dang rim min ma yin pas //
translated: Not in order or out of order,üîΩone will undoubtedly attain

original: ye shes longs spyod rdzogs pa dang // sprul pa thob par 'don mi za //
analyzed: ye shes longs spyod rdzogs pa dang // sprul pa thob par 'don mi za //
translated: the gnosis, the Enjoyment, and the Emanation Bodies.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag ma rnams go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag ma rnams go sla'o //
translated: This is easy to understand.

original: gsang sngags 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the mantra of this mantra, etc.,

original: gsang sngags 'di ni rtsa ba'i nye ba'i snying po'i sngags so //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di ni rtsa ba'i nye ba'i snying po'i sngags so //
translated: this mantra is the root mantra of the near essence.

original: snying po ni snying po'i gsang sngags te /
analyzed: snying po ni snying po'i gsang sngags te /
translated: The essence is the essence mantra.

original: de yang snying po las kyang snying po'i las kyi cho ga zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang snying po las kyang snying po'i las kyi cho ga zhes pa'i don to //
translated: And that is the essence of the essence, the ritual action of the essence.

original: snying po gsang ba'i sngags kyi sgrub pa po ni dpal he ru ka nyid sgrub pa po nyid cig bshad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: snying po gsang ba'i sngags kyi sgrub pa po ni dpal he ru ka nyid sgrub pa po nyid cig bshad par bya ba ste /
translated: The secret mantra adept, the essence, is explained to be glorious Heruka himself.

original: da rdo rje phag mos sam /
analyzed: da rdo rje phag mos sam /
translated: Or, Vajravarahi herself.

original: gsang ba'i sgrub pa po yang da nyid yin gyi zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsang ba'i sgrub pa po yang da nyid yin gyi zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Or, the secret adept is just this.

original: lhag ma ni ci lta ba'i don nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ci lta ba'i don nyid do //
translated: The rest has the meaning of just what is.

original: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i sku gsum dang grub pa'i snying po'i las kyi cho ga'i le'u bcu pa'i 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i sku gsum dang grub pa'i snying po'i las kyi cho ga'i le'u bcu pa'i 'grel ba'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the tenth chapter of the glorious Heruka Tantra, the section on the three bodies and the essence of the rites.

original: // / de nas gzhan yang rab bshad bya //
analyzed: // / de nas gzhan yang rab bshad bya //
translated: Now, moreover, I will explainüîΩthe seven-day rite, which is the essence of the rites.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: This and so forth is easy to understand.

original: bden par smra ba dang yun ring por mig mi 'dzums pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bden par smra ba dang yun ring por mig mi 'dzums pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Speaking the truth and not closing the eyes for a long time

original: kha cig mig yun ring por gdangs pa la zer te /
analyzed: kha cig mig yun ring por gdangs pa la zer te /
translated: means that some say that the eyes are open for a long time.

original: gzhan ni myur du 'dzums pa la 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan ni myur du 'dzums pa la 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that they are quickly closed.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i skye ba bdun pa'i mtshan nyid cho ga'i le'u bcu gcig pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i skye ba bdun pa'i mtshan nyid cho ga'i le'u bcu gcig pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the eleventh chapter of the glorious Heruka Tantra, the characteristics of the seven-birth rite.

original: // / de nas nye ba'i snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: // / de nas nye ba'i snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
